headline: Strawberry Daiquiri Mousse

video.description: Strawberry mousse is the perfect end to a warm-weather meal. This one uses Domino Golden Sugar, a less-processed sugar, to give it an extra light and airy texture. Then, rather than fold in plain strawberries, we spiked our strawberry mixture with a little rum. The no-bake dessert is so ridiculously simple, you can make it in the morning and let it chill in the fridge until you’re ready to top with more rum-soaked strawberries and serve. (If planning ahead is more your move, you can easily whip them up the night before and refrigerate overnight.)
video.name: Strawberry Daiquiri Mousse Is What Dessert Dreams Are Made Of

description: This Strawberry Daiquiri Mousse is the refreshing twist you’ll want to serve up all summer long.

author.name: Laura Rege
author.description:
Expertise: One Pot Meals, Quick Easy Weeknight Meals, Comfort Food, and Indulgent Desserts.

Education: Culinary Arts degree from The French Culinary Institute, Bachelor's degree from Tulane University

About Me: As a Contributing Recipe Developer for Delish, Laura Rege crafts indulgent, approachable, and eye-catching recipes. Her most popular Delish recipes include Lemon-Cranberry Cheesecake Bars and One-Pot Coconut Lime Chicken.  Laura's work has been featured in publications such as Martha Stewart Living, Food & Wine, and Pioneer Woman's magazine. She is currently the Food Director at HexClad. Beyond the kitchen, Laura enjoys exploring the vibrant culinary scene of her hometown, Los Angeles, and finding moments of balance through activities like yoga and breathwork.

author.name: Jackie Rothong
author.description: Jackie Rothong is an Emmy award-winning culinary producer, food stylist, recipe developer and chef with over a decade of experience in food television, video production, recipe development and on-camera appearances within editorial, digital and national platforms.

name: Strawberry Daiquiri Mousse
recipeIngredient: 2 large eggs, yolks and whites separated

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, muddle ½ pound strawberries. Stir in 2 tablespoons sugar and 2 oz. white rum, cover and refrigerate.
In a food processor, pulse remaining strawberries, 2 tablespoons sugar, lemon zest, and juice until smooth. Transfer to a large bowl and stir in rum.

Create a double boiler by bringing a medium pot filled a little less than halfway with water to a simmer. Place a heatproof bowl that's just big enough to sit on top of the pot and whisk egg yolks until yolks slightly thicken, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and combine with strawberry mixture.

In a medium bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer, whisk egg whites and a pinch of salt until stiff peaks form. During the last 30 seconds of whisking, slowly add in 2 tablespoons sugar. Fold whipped egg whites into strawberry mixture. In the same bowl, whisk heavy cream until stiff peaks form, about 3 minutes. Fold in whipped cream to strawberry mixture.
Divide mousse between serving dishes. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. Garnish with smashed strawberry rum floaters before serving.

keywords: dessert, partnerships, Strawberry Daiquiri Mousse, summer treats, Domino Golden Sugar
